description: The Practical IT Security series is designed to answer the "HOW" questions that we all have from time to time surrounding everyday IT security issues and concerns across a variety of topics. We explain the concepts, discuss the technologies, and then show you how to do it !!!, no fuss, no muss, just simple to follow guidance and answers for those things that you just have to get done.
descriptionMD: The Practical IT Security series is designed to answer the "HOW" questions that we all have from time to time surrounding everyday IT security issues and concerns across a variety of topics. We explain the concepts, discuss the technologies, and then show you how to do it !!!, no fuss, no muss, just simple to follow guidance and answers for those things that you just have to get done.
name: Practical IT Security
subtitle: Hands-On answers to security questions

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel discuss the differences between single, dual, and Multi-Factor authentication. They also discuss how to setup Windows Hello on a
stand alone Windows 10 machine.
episodes.title: Multi-Factor Authentication

episodes.description:
Adam and Daniel discuss the Group Policy Object settings to enable Windows Hello and biometrics support. In addition, they also begin the discussion
of how to setup and configure Active Directory Certificate Services (ADCS).
episodes.title: Multi-Factor Authentication Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the installation of a subordinate CA. In addition, they also discuss the properties of a certificate and what certificate
episodes.title: Multi-Factor Authentication Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss how to access, modify, manage, and enable certificate templates. In addition, they also discuss how to request a user certificate through the auto-enrollment process.
episodes.title: Multi-Factor Authentication Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue the discussion about how to access, modify, manage, and enable certificate templates. In addition, they also discuss how to request a user certificate through the auto-enrollment process.
episodes.title: Multi-Factor Authentication Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the overview of what patch management is. They also begin to discuss how to use WSUS to enable patch management in a Microsoft centric organization.
episodes.title: Patch Management

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel begin the demonstration of how to use WSUS to enable patch management in a Microsoft centric organization.
episodes.title: Patch Management Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel continue the demonstration of how to use WSUS to enable patch management in a Microsoft centric organization.
episodes.title: Patch Management Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel finish up the demonstration of how to use WSUS to enable patch management in a Microsoft centric organization. In addition, Daniel shows you how to manage patching using an automated script in Linux.
episodes.title: Patch Management Part 4

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss the issues associated with password security. They examine what a personal password manager is, and show you what to do in order to make your password secure, as well as mechanisms for secure transmission of passwords.
episodes.title: Password Hygiene

episodes.description: Description: Adam and Daniel discuss enterprise grade password management solutions. In addition, they also examine the ADDS GPO settings that help us to address password security in the enterprise. Adam shows you how to create and use a USB security key.
episodes.title: Password Hygiene Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Daniel discuss what Social Engineering is and examine a phishing e-mail to identify key warning signs of phishing.
episodes.title: Social Engineering

episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam discuss user account best practices working in MacOS.  They demonstrate how to create a second standard user, disable automatic login and disable passwords hints.
episodes.title: MacOS Hardening

episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam discuss disk and volume security. They show how to implement FileVault and the options (iCloud or local) available when configuring it and keeping the recovery key. They use the terminal to ensure the the FileVault Keys are not stored in RAM while the system goes into stand by. They also discuss if FileVault will cause any issues with virtualization technology.
episodes.title: MacOS Hardening Part 2

episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam discuss file security as a continuation of disk security too.  They show how to delete files securely and deal with metadata creation on network files and even USB volumes.
episodes.title: MacOS Hardening Part 3

episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam discuss basic networking security in MacOS.  They discuss the good practice of understanding and seeing what networks you may connecting to.  They also show where to adjust and set the network connection and how to disable it when needed or plug into a network with a cabled connection.  They also look at the different options in Firewall and look at how to enable and block as well as using stealth mode.
episodes.title: MacOS Hardening Part 4

episodes.description: Ronnie and Adam dive into Application Security.  They discuss and show the update options for apple related apps and third party apps.  They also show to restrict where trusted apps can be installed from--either appstore or developers website.  They also take a look at some of the privacy settings and information that can be communicated by using these settings.
episodes.title: MacOS Hardening Part 5

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss encryption methods.
episodes.title: Encryption

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie dive into Application Security.  They discuss and show the update options for apple related apps and third party apps.  They also show to restrict where trusted apps can be installed from--either appstore or developers website.  They also take a look at some of the privacy settings and information that can be communicated by using these settings.
episodes.title: Encryption Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie dive into Application Security.  They discuss and show the update options for apple related apps and third party apps.  They also show to restrict where trusted apps can be installed from--either appstore or developers website.  They also take a look at some of the privacy settings and information that can be communicated by using these settings.
episodes.title: Browser Security

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie dive into Application Security.  They discuss and show the update options for apple related apps and third party apps.  They also show to restrict where trusted apps can be installed from--either appstore or developers website.  They also take a look at some of the privacy settings and information that can be communicated by using these settings.
episodes.title: Browser Security Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie take a look at setting up mobile device security.  With the proliferation of tablets devices, they use an iPad to show some of the simple security settings an IT Professional should consider using to provide more security when helping users set these devices.  They discuss using the lockscreen, erasing the device and controlling the privacy settings.  They also demonstrate how to disable some of features that retain and even report some of the PII, personally identifiable information.
episodes.title: Mobile Device Security

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie focus on android phone security settings. They demonstrate how to enable things like biometrics and discuss setting PINs too.  They look at some of the advanced security settings that can be enabled. They discuss the need for individuals to take time and explore these settings in order to understand what will be appropriate for them.
episodes.title: Mobile Device Security Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie take a look at and discuss security settings that are seldom discussed, including the service provider security software packages as well as some of the advanced Android OS based settings.  Adam describes and shows some of the settings in these vendor packages.  He also emphasizes the use of encrypting the device along with the removable storage as well.
episodes.title: Mobile Device Security Part 3

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss the need for initial Cisco device security.  With Cisco routers and switches being part of many network infrastructures, they talk about the need to do basic device configuration to secure access to these devices prior to deployment.  Using the CLI, they show how to set basic passwords for accessing a Cisco switch.  They also demonstrate how to enable the use of encryption to protect passwords.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie continue with securing Cisco devices, focusing on securing network access through the use of SSH.  They demonstrate that data can be seen on the wire if this traffic is not secured.  The discuss and demonstrate how to setup SSH access on the switch.  Then demonstrate using Wireshark, the difference when using SSH to access the device.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security Part 2

episodes.description: Adam and Ronnie discuss basic port security when setting up and deploying a device for production.  They describe what a VLAN is and why it's used in security.  Using the Cisco switch, they describe the default configuration of the switchport which allows devices to plug in immediately and work. They also show how to implement the most basic port security using VLANs and shutting down ports.  Lastly, they demonstrate how to use tftp to upload a newer Cisco IOS to the switch from the tftp server.
episodes.title: Basic Cisco Device Security Part 3
